ingredients: Black pepper – freshly ground, to taste
1 teaspoon olive oil – for greasing muffin tray
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing the Muffin Mixture:
In a bowl, crack the eggs and beat lightly with milk, salt, black pepper, and chili flakes. Stir in the grated cheese, chopped onion, tomato, bell pepper, and coriander. Ensure a homogenous mixture without lumps.

Step 2 – Preheating Oven and Muffin Tray:
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Lightly grease a muffin tray with olive oil to prevent sticking. Ensure even coating to allow easy removal of muffins later.

Step 3 – Filling Muffin Cups:
Pour the egg mixture into the greased muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full to allow room for rising. Ensure even distribution of vegetables and cheese for consistency.

Step 4 – Baking the Egg Muffins:
Place the tray in the preheated oven. Bake for 20–25 minutes, checking after 15 minutes. The muffins are done when a toothpick inserted comes out clean and the top is golden brown.

Step 5 – Cooling and Removing:
Allow muffins to cool for 5 minutes in the tray. Carefully remove using a spatula or knife around the edges. This prevents breakage and maintains the shape.

Step 6 – Serving:
Serve warm with ketchup, green chutney, or a light salad. These are perfect for breakfast, brunch, or snacks.

Step 7 – Tips:
- Use fresh eggs for better rise.
- Do not overfill the cups to prevent spillage.
- Experiment with mushrooms, spinach, or olives for variety.
- Adjust cheese type for different flavors.
howToServe: Serve hot as breakfast, brunch, or snack. Pair with ketchup, green chutney, or a fresh salad. Ideal for kids and adults alike.

name: Egg Bhurji (Indian Spiced Scrambled Eggs)
ingredients: Optional: 1 tablespoon milk – for creamier texture
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Ingredients:
Finely chop the onion, tomato, green chili, and optional bell pepper. Crack the eggs into a bowl and beat lightly with salt, turmeric, and optional milk for creaminess. Keep chopped coriander ready for garnish.

Step 2 – Tempering Spices:
Heat oil or ghee in a non-stick pan on medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds until aromatic. This releases the base flavor for the dish.

Step 3 – Sautéing Vegetables:
Add chopped onions (and bell pepper if using) to the pan. Sauté for 3–4 minutes until onions are translucent. Add green chili and cook for 30 seconds to release its heat. Then add chopped tomatoes and cook for 2–3 minutes until slightly mushy.

Step 4 – Adding Spices:
Sprinkle red chili powder and garam masala over the cooked vegetables. Stir thoroughly to ensure even coating. Adjust spice levels according to your taste.

Step 5 – Cooking Eggs:
Lower the heat slightly and pour the beaten eggs into the pan. Allow the eggs to sit for 30 seconds, then start gently stirring with a spatula. Fold and stir intermittently, scraping the pan edges to cook eggs evenly.

Step 6 – Scrambling to Perfection:
Cook for 3–5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until eggs are fully set but still soft and moist. Avoid overcooking; the eggs should be tender and slightly creamy.

Step 7 – Garnishing:
Turn off the heat and sprinkle fresh coriander over the top. Mix gently to incorporate the aroma without breaking the soft texture.

Step 8 – Optional Enhancements:
You can add a pinch of chaat masala for tanginess, or sprinkle a little grated cheese for richness. Serve with toasted bread, pav, roti, or paratha.

Step 9 – Checking Texture:
Egg Bhurji should have a slightly moist consistency, not dry. The vegetables should still provide slight bite and contrast to the soft eggs.

Step 10 – Serving Hot:
Serve immediately to retain freshness, flavor, and aroma. Pair with tomato ketchup or green chutney if desired. This makes a wholesome breakfast or light meal, packed with protein and spices.

Step 11 – Tips:
- Use medium heat to prevent browning.
- Fresh eggs give the best flavor and texture.
- Stir gently to avoid tough, rubbery eggs.
- Experiment with vegetables like mushrooms, peas, or carrots for variation.
- Adjust chili and spices according to taste preferences.
howToServe: Serve Egg Bhurji hot with buttered pav, chapati, paratha, or toasted bread. Garnish with fresh coriander and a side of sliced onions or tomato wedges for a complete meal.

name: Spanish Egg Tortilla
ingredients: 2 medium potatoes – peeled and thinly sliced
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Potatoes:
Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a non-stick pan. Add sliced potatoes, season with salt and pepper, and cook on low heat until soft but not browned.

Step 2 – Cooking Onions:
Add sliced onions to the potatoes and sauté gently until translucent. Mix carefully to avoid breaking potato slices.

Step 3 – Beating Eggs:
In a bowl, beat eggs with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Combine with cooked potatoes and onions.

Step 4 – Cooking Tortilla:
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in the pan. Pour egg mixture evenly, spreading potatoes and onions. Cook on medium-low heat for 5–6 minutes until edges are set.

Step 5 – Flipping Tortilla:
Carefully invert the tortilla using a plate, slide back into the pan, and cook another 3–4 minutes until fully cooked.

Step 6 – Finishing Touch:
Slide tortilla onto a serving plate, garnish with fresh parsley, and allow to rest 2 minutes.

Step 7 – Serving:
Serve warm or at room temperature as brunch, snack, or light meal.

Step 8 – Tips:
- Use medium-low heat to avoid browning too quickly.
- Ensure potatoes are soft before adding eggs.
- Slice potatoes uniformly for even cooking.
howToServe: Serve Spanish Egg Tortilla warm or at room temperature. Accompany with salad, bread, or tomato chutney.

name: Egg Tacos
ingredients: Salt and black pepper – to taste
Fresh coriander or lettuce – for garnish
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Vegetables:
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a pan. Sauté diced bell peppers and onions for 3–4 minutes until soft. Season with cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.

Step 2 – Cooking Eggs:
In a bowl, beat eggs lightly. Pour into the pan with sautéed vegetables. Stir continuously to scramble until just set but still moist.

Step 3 – Preparing Tortillas:
Warm tortillas on a dry pan or oven for 1–2 minutes to make them pliable.

Step 4 – Assembling Tacos:
Spoon scrambled eggs and vegetables onto each tortilla. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top.

Step 5 – Garnishing:
Add fresh coriander or lettuce and drizzle with salsa if desired.

Step 6 – Serving:
Fold tortillas and serve immediately for breakfast or snack.

Step 7 – Tips:
- Do not overcook eggs; they should be soft.
- Warm tortillas prevent cracking.
- Add avocado or sour cream for extra flavor.
howToServe: Serve Egg Tacos immediately, warm, as breakfast, brunch, or snack. Pair with salsa or guacamole for enhanced taste.

name: Shakshuka
ingredients: Salt and black pepper – to taste
Fresh coriander or parsley – for garnish
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Sauce:
Heat olive oil in a skillet. Add onions and bell pepper, sauté for 5–6 minutes until soft. Add garlic, paprika, cumin, and chili flakes, sauté 1 minute until fragrant.

Step 2 – Adding Tomatoes:
Pour in crushed tomatoes. Simmer for 10–12 minutes on medium-low heat until thickened. Season with salt and black pepper.

Step 3 – Adding Eggs:
Make small wells in the tomato sauce and crack an egg into each well. Cover and cook 6–8 minutes until eggs are done to your preference (runny yolk or fully set).

Step 4 – Garnishing:
Sprinkle chopped coriander or parsley and optional feta cheese.

Step 5 – Serving:
Serve hot with toasted bread or pita for dipping.

Step 6 – Tips:
- Use medium heat to prevent burning sauce.
- Cover pan while cooking eggs for even cooking.
- Adjust spice level with chili flakes.
howToServe: Serve Shakshuka hot, directly from the skillet, with toasted bread or pita. Ideal for breakfast or brunch.

name: Quinoa Vegetable Salad
ingredients: Black pepper – freshly ground, to taste
2 tablespoons fresh parsley or coriander – chopped
steps:
Step 1 – Cooking Quinoa:
In a saucepan, bring water or vegetable broth to boil. Add rinsed quinoa, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 15–20 minutes until water is absorbed and quinoa is fluffy. Fluff with a fork and allow to cool.

Step 2 – Preparing Vegetables:
Wash, dice, and grate all vegetables. Ensure uniform pieces for better mixing and presentation.

Step 3 – Making Dressing:
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper. Adjust seasoning to taste.

Step 4 – Combining Ingredients:
In a large mixing bowl, combine cooked quinoa and chopped vegetables. Drizzle dressing and toss gently to coat evenly.

Step 5 – Garnishing:
Sprinkle chopped parsley or coriander and roasted sunflower seeds for added crunch and nutrition.

Step 6 – Resting and Serving:
Allow salad to rest for 5–10 minutes so flavors blend. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Step 7 – Tips:
- Use freshly cooked quinoa for better texture.
- Adjust olive oil and lemon juice for tanginess.
- Add avocado or feta for creaminess and extra protein.
howToServe: Serve chilled or at room temperature as a healthy lunch, light dinner, or snack. Garnish with fresh herbs and seeds for added flavor and crunch.

name: Grilled Chicken with Steamed Vegetables
ingredients: Salt and black pepper – to taste
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Chicken:
Pat chicken breasts dry. Rub with olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Allow marination for 15–20 minutes.

Step 2 – Preheating Grill:
Preheat a grill pan or outdoor grill to medium-high heat.

Step 3 – Grilling Chicken:
Grill chicken breasts 5–7 minutes on each side until fully cooked (internal temperature 75°C/165°F). Avoid overcooking to keep chicken tender.

Step 4 – Steaming Vegetables:
Steam broccoli, carrots, and green beans until tender but still crisp. Avoid overcooking to preserve nutrients.

Step 5 – Plating:
Slice chicken diagonally, arrange with steamed vegetables on a plate. Drizzle with lemon juice.

Step 6 – Garnishing:
Sprinkle fresh parsley for aroma and color.

Step 7 – Serving:
Serve hot as a nutritious lunch or dinner, high in protein and vitamins.

Step 8 – Tips:
- Avoid excessive oil for healthier meal.
- Steam vegetables lightly to retain crunch and nutrients.
- Pair with quinoa or brown rice for a complete meal.
howToServe: Serve hot as a wholesome, high-protein meal. Pair with quinoa, brown rice, or a light salad for a balanced diet.

name: Oats and Vegetable Upma
steps:
Step 1 – Roasting Oats:
Dry roast oats in a pan for 3–4 minutes until slightly aromatic. Set aside.

Step 2 – Tempering:
Heat olive oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, and green chili. Sauté until mustard seeds pop.

Step 3 – Cooking Vegetables:
Add onions, sauté until translucent. Add diced carrots and beans, cook 3–4 minutes until slightly tender.

Step 4 – Adding Water and Oats:
Pour 2 cups water and salt. Bring to a boil. Gradually add roasted oats, stirring continuously to prevent lumps.

Step 5 – Simmering:
Reduce heat and simmer 5–7 minutes until oats absorb water and reach soft, porridge-like consistency.

Step 6 – Final Touch:
Turn off heat, add lemon juice (optional) and chopped coriander. Mix gently.

Step 7 – Serving:
Serve hot as a light breakfast or snack. Garnish with fresh coriander.

Step 8 – Tips:
- Roast oats for better flavor.
- Use seasonal vegetables for variety.
- Adjust water for desired consistency.
howToServe: Serve hot for breakfast or snack. Pair with a cup of herbal tea or fresh fruit for a complete healthy meal.

name: Grilled Fish with Lemon-Herb Dressing
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Fish:
Pat fish fillets dry. Rub with olive oil, garlic paste, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Marinate for 15–20 minutes.

Step 2 – Preheating Grill:
Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.

Step 3 – Grilling Fish:
Grill fish 4–5 minutes per side until cooked through and grill marks appear. Avoid overcooking to retain moisture.

Step 4 – Preparing Dressing:
Mix a little olive oil, lemon juice, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper for extra drizzle.

Step 5 – Plating:
Place fish on a plate, drizzle with lemon-herb dressing. Garnish with parsley and lemon slices.

Step 6 – Serving:
Serve hot with steamed vegetables or quinoa for a balanced, low-calorie meal.

Step 7 – Tips:
- Use fresh fish for best flavor.
- Avoid overcrowding the grill.
- Marinate adequately for flavor infusion.
howToServe: Serve grilled fish hot with steamed vegetables, quinoa, or brown rice. Drizzle dressing and garnish with lemon slices for freshness.

name: Chickpea & Spinach Stir-Fry
ingredients: Salt and black pepper – to taste
steps:
Step 1 – Tempering:
Heat olive oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and garlic. Sauté until aromatic.

Step 2 – Cooking Vegetables:
Add onions, sauté until translucent. Add tomatoes and cook 2–3 minutes until soft.

Step 3 – Adding Chickpeas:
Add cooked chickpeas, paprika, salt, and black pepper. Stir fry for 4–5 minutes.

Step 4 – Adding Spinach:
Add spinach leaves in batches, stir until wilted and well mixed.

Step 5 – Finishing Touch:
Sprinkle lemon juice and mix gently. Garnish with chopped coriander.

Step 6 – Serving:
Serve hot as a light meal, side dish, or healthy snack.

Step 7 – Tips:
- Avoid overcooking spinach to retain nutrients.
- Add a pinch of chili flakes for extra flavor.
- Use fresh lemon juice for bright taste.
howToServe: Serve hot as a light lunch or side dish. Pair with whole-grain bread or brown rice for a nutritious, protein-rich meal.

name: Mango Milkshake
ingredients: 1 cup ripe mango pulp (fresh or canned)
1–2 teaspoons honey or sugar (optional, based on sweetness of mango)
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Mango Pulp:
Start by peeling and chopping ripe mangoes. Blend them to a smooth pulp in a blender. If using canned pulp, measure and ensure it is thick and ripe. The sweetness of mango should be balanced; if it’s too tart, add a teaspoon of honey.

Step 2 – Chilling Milk:
Ensure that the milk is chilled beforehand. Cold milk helps achieve a refreshing, creamy shake. Pour it into the blender along with the mango pulp.

Step 3 – Adding Ice Cream:
Add two scoops of vanilla ice cream to the blender. This not only thickens the shake but also provides a smooth, creamy texture. Ice cream should be at room temperature for easier blending.

Step 4 – Adding Flavor Enhancers:
Add cardamom powder for a subtle aromatic touch. Optionally, include extra sugar or honey if the mangoes are less sweet. Add ice cubes if you want a colder, more refreshing milkshake.

Step 5 – Blending:
Blend the mixture at high speed for 1–2 minutes until smooth and frothy. Ensure that ice cubes and mango pulp are well incorporated. Check the consistency; if too thick, add a little more chilled milk and blend again. The shake should be creamy, smooth, and slightly thick.

Step 6 – Serving Glasses:
Pour the milkshake into tall glasses, filling up to three-fourths to leave space for toppings. This allows for a layered presentation.

Step 7 – Toppings and Garnish:
Top each glass with a dollop of whipped cream. Garnish with thin slices of fresh mango or a sprinkle of cardamom powder. For a decorative touch, drizzle a little honey on top.

Step 8 – Presentation Tips:
Serve immediately for the best taste and texture. The milkshake should be cold and frothy. Use tall transparent glasses to showcase the golden yellow color of mangoes.

Step 9 – Optional Enhancements:
You can also add a pinch of saffron soaked in a teaspoon of warm milk for a richer flavor. Alternatively, add a few crushed nuts like almonds or pistachios on top for texture and visual appeal.

Step 10 – Tips for Best Results:
- Use ripe, juicy mangoes for natural sweetness.
- Ensure all ingredients are cold before blending.
- Blend thoroughly for smooth texture without lumps.
- Adjust sugar according to the sweetness of mangoes.
- Serve immediately to enjoy the creamy and chilled milkshake.
howToServe: Serve immediately in tall glasses. Garnish with whipped cream and fresh mango slices. Can be paired with cookies or a light snack for a refreshing treat.

name: Vanilla Almond Milkshake
ingredients: 1/4 cup roasted almonds – soaked for 2 hours
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Almonds:
Soak the roasted almonds in water for at least 2 hours. After soaking, peel the skin and blend into a smooth almond paste using a little milk. This paste provides a nutty flavor and creamy texture.

Step 2 – Chilling Milk:
Use cold, whole milk for a rich milkshake. Pour the milk into the blender along with almond paste. The cold temperature helps create a frothy texture.

Step 3 – Adding Ice Cream:
Add vanilla ice cream into the blender. This will thicken the milkshake and give a smooth, creamy consistency. Ice cream should be soft enough to blend easily.

Step 4 – Flavor Enhancement:
Add almond extract for a strong nutty aroma. Optionally, add sugar if extra sweetness is desired.

Step 5 – Ice Cubes and Blending:
Add ice cubes to make the milkshake chilled and refreshing. Blend at high speed for 2–3 minutes until completely smooth, frothy, and creamy. Check the consistency; if too thick, add a little milk.

Step 6 – Preparing Glasses:
Pour the milkshake into tall glasses, leaving room for toppings. This ensures a visually appealing presentation.

Step 7 – Garnishing:
Top with whipped cream and sprinkle chopped almonds on top. This adds texture and enhances visual appeal.

Step 8 – Serving Tips:
Serve immediately to maintain creamy texture and chilled freshness. Milkshake can separate if left too long.

Step 9 – Optional Enhancements:
Add a few drops of vanilla essence for extra flavor or a pinch of cinnamon for a warm undertone. You can also add a drizzle of honey on top.

Step 10 – Tips for Best Results:
- Use fresh, soaked almonds for nutty flavor.
- Ensure milk and ice cream are chilled.
- Blend thoroughly to remove lumps.
- Serve immediately for optimal texture and taste.
howToServe: Serve immediately in tall glasses, topped with whipped cream and chopped almonds. Perfect as a refreshing, protein-rich drink.

name: Cookies and Cream Milkshake
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Cookies:
Separate the Oreo cookies and keep them ready. You can slightly crush them before adding to the blender for easier blending.

Step 2 – Chilling Milk and Ice Cream:
Ensure milk is chilled. Scoop vanilla ice cream into a bowl for easy blending.

Step 3 – Blending Milkshake:
In a blender, combine chilled milk, ice cream, and cookies. Blend at high speed for 1–2 minutes until smooth and creamy. Check consistency; add extra milk if too thick.

Step 4 – Adding Flavor Enhancer:
Optionally, add a teaspoon of chocolate syrup for a richer chocolate flavor. Blend again briefly to incorporate.

Step 5 – Preparing Glasses:
Pour the milkshake into tall glasses, leaving space for whipped cream and garnishes.

Step 6 – Toppings and Garnish:
Top with whipped cream and sprinkle crushed cookies on top for texture. Drizzle a little chocolate syrup for decorative appeal.

Step 7 – Serving Tips:
Serve immediately to enjoy creamy texture and freshness. Milkshake tastes best cold.

Step 8 – Optional Enhancements:
You can add a scoop of chocolate ice cream to intensify flavor or mix in a few mini chocolate chips for texture.

Step 9 – Tips for Best Results:
- Blend thoroughly to remove cookie lumps.
- Use cold milk and ice cream for frosty texture.
- Adjust cookie quantity based on preference for crunch and flavor.
- Serve immediately for best taste and texture.
howToServe: Serve chilled in tall glasses, topped with whipped cream, crushed cookies, and chocolate drizzle. Perfect for dessert or afternoon refreshment.

name: Mocha Coffee Milkshake
steps:
Step 1 – Dissolving Coffee:
Dissolve instant coffee powder in a tablespoon of warm water or milk. This ensures smooth blending and prevents coffee granules in the shake.

Step 2 – Chilling Ingredients:
Ensure milk is cold. Scoop chocolate ice cream into a bowl for easy addition.

Step 3 – Blending Milkshake:
In a blender, combine chilled milk, dissolved coffee, chocolate ice cream, and ice cubes. Blend at high speed for 1–2 minutes until frothy and smooth. Check consistency; adjust milk or ice cream as needed.

Step 4 – Preparing Glasses:
Pour milkshake into tall glasses, leaving space for toppings.

Step 5 – Toppings and Garnish:
Top with whipped cream and sprinkle chocolate shavings. Optionally, drizzle chocolate syrup for visual appeal and extra flavor.

Step 6 – Serving Tips:
Serve immediately for best taste. The milkshake should be cold, frothy, and creamy.

Step 7 – Optional Enhancements:
Add a scoop of coffee ice cream for stronger coffee flavor. Sprinkle cocoa powder or crushed coffee beans for decoration.

Step 8 – Tips for Best Results:
- Use cold milk and ice cream to maintain texture.
- Blend thoroughly to avoid lumps.
- Adjust coffee and sugar according to taste.
- Serve immediately to enjoy frothy and chilled milkshake.
howToServe: Serve chilled in tall glasses, topped with whipped cream, chocolate shavings, and optional chocolate syrup. Perfect for coffee lovers as a dessert beverage.

name: Pistachio Milkshake
ingredients: 1/4 cup shelled pistachios – soaked for 2 hours
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Pistachios:
Soak pistachios in water for 2 hours. Blend into a smooth paste using a little milk.

Step 2 – Chilling Milk:
Use cold, whole milk. Pour milk into blender along with pistachio paste.

Step 3 – Adding Ice Cream:
Add vanilla ice cream to the blender. Ice cream should be slightly soft for smooth blending.

Step 4 – Flavor Enhancer:
Add rose water for aromatic flavor. Add sugar if pistachios are unsweetened.

Step 5 – Adding Ice Cubes and Blending:
Add ice cubes to keep milkshake cold. Blend at high speed for 2–3 minutes until smooth, frothy, and creamy.

Step 6 – Preparing Glasses:
Pour into tall glasses, leaving space for toppings.

Step 7 – Garnish:
Top with whipped cream and sprinkle chopped pistachios. For extra flavor, drizzle a little honey.

Step 8 – Serving Tips:
Serve immediately for creamy texture and chilled freshness.

Step 9 – Optional Enhancements:
You can add a pinch of saffron soaked in warm milk for a luxurious aroma. Serve with thin almond slices for crunch.

Step 10 – Tips for Best Results:
- Use fresh, soaked pistachios for nutty flavor.
- Keep milk and ice cream chilled.
- Blend thoroughly for smooth consistency.
- Serve immediately to retain cold and creamy texture.
howToServe: Serve immediately chilled in tall glasses, topped with whipped cream and chopped pistachios. Perfect for a refreshing, nutty dessert drink.

name: Classic Alfredo Fettuccine
ingredients: Black pepper – freshly ground, to taste
steps:
Step 1 – Cooking Pasta:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add fettuccine and cook according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and reserve 1/4 cup pasta water for later use.

Step 2 – Preparing Alfredo Sauce:
In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté for 1–2 minutes until fragrant, avoiding burning.

Step 3 – Adding Cream:
Pour in heavy cream and stir continuously. Let it simmer gently for 3–4 minutes until slightly thickened.

Step 4 – Incorporating Cheese:
Gradually add grated Parmesan cheese while stirring. Continue cooking until the cheese melts and the sauce becomes smooth and creamy.

Step 5 – Adjusting Consistency:
If the sauce is too thick, add a little reserved pasta water. Stir to achieve a velvety consistency.

Step 6 – Combining Pasta and Sauce:
Add cooked fettuccine to the sauce. Toss gently to coat pasta evenly with the creamy Alfredo sauce.

Step 7 – Seasoning:
Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Toss again for even distribution.

Step 8 – Plating:
Serve the pasta hot in shallow bowls.

Step 9 – Garnishing:
Sprinkle freshly chopped parsley and extra Parmesan cheese on top for flavor and presentation.

Step 10 – Tips for Best Results:
- Use freshly grated Parmesan for smooth melting.
- Avoid overcooking pasta; al dente texture absorbs sauce better.
- Stir continuously to prevent sauce from curdling.
- Serve immediately to enjoy creamy texture.
howToServe: Serve hot in shallow bowls, garnished with chopped parsley and extra Parmesan cheese. Pair with garlic bread or a fresh salad for a complete meal.

name: Veg Hakka Noodles
ingredients: Black pepper – freshly ground, to taste
steps:
Step 1 – Cooking Noodles:
Boil Hakka noodles in salted water according to package instructions. Drain, rinse under cold water, and toss with a little oil to prevent sticking.

Step 2 – Stir-Frying Vegetables:
Heat oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and sauté for 30 seconds. Add sliced onions, carrots, capsicum, and cabbage. Stir-fry for 3–4 minutes until slightly tender but crisp.

Step 3 – Adding Sauces:
Add soy sauce, chili sauce, and vinegar to the wok. Mix thoroughly to coat vegetables evenly.

Step 4 – Combining Noodles and Vegetables:
Add cooked noodles to the wok. Toss continuously for 2–3 minutes so the noodles absorb the sauce and flavors.

Step 5 – Seasoning:
Adjust salt and pepper as per taste. Stir well.

Step 6 – Garnishing:
Turn off the heat and garnish with chopped spring onions.

Step 7 – Serving:
Serve hot in a plate or bowl for an authentic Indo-Chinese flavor.

Step 8 – Tips for Best Results:
- Stir-fry on high heat to retain crispiness of vegetables.
- Do not overcook noodles; al dente texture works best.
- Toss continuously to avoid sticking and uneven cooking.
howToServe: Serve hot, garnished with spring onions. Pair with Manchurian gravy or hot sauce for a complete Indo-Chinese meal.

name: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper – to taste
steps:
Step 1 – Cooking Spaghetti:
Boil spaghetti in salted water until al dente. Drain and reserve a little pasta water.

Step 2 – Preparing Garlic Oil:
Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add sliced garlic and sauté until golden brown, ensuring it does not burn.

Step 3 – Adding Chili Flakes:
Add red chili flakes to the garlic oil and stir for 30 seconds to release aroma.

Step 4 – Combining Pasta:
Add cooked spaghetti to the pan. Toss well to coat with garlic oil. If too dry, add a little reserved pasta water.

Step 5 – Seasoning:
Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Toss again for even flavor distribution.

Step 6 – Plating:
Serve hot in shallow bowls.

Step 7 – Garnishing:
Sprinkle chopped parsley and optionally, grated Parmesan cheese.

Step 8 – Tips for Best Results:
- Do not overcook garlic; it should be golden and fragrant.
- Use good quality olive oil for authentic flavor.
- Toss pasta immediately after adding oil to coat evenly.
howToServe: Serve immediately while hot, garnished with parsley and Parmesan. Pair with garlic bread or light salad.

name: Chicken Schezwan Noodles
steps:
Step 1 – Cooking Noodles:
Boil Hakka noodles in salted water until al dente. Drain and toss with a little oil.

Step 2 – Cooking Chicken:
Heat oil in a wok. Add minced garlic and sauté. Add sliced chicken and cook until no longer pink.

Step 3 – Stir-Frying Vegetables:
Add onions, capsicum, and cabbage. Stir-fry for 2–3 minutes until slightly tender.

Step 4 – Adding Sauces:
Add Schezwan sauce, soy sauce, and vinegar. Stir well.

Step 5 – Combining Noodles:
Add cooked noodles to the wok. Toss continuously to coat noodles with sauce and mix with chicken and vegetables.

Step 6 – Seasoning:
Adjust salt and black pepper. Mix well.

Step 7 – Garnishing:
Turn off heat and garnish with chopped spring onions.

Step 8 – Serving:
Serve hot for a spicy Indo-Chinese flavor.

Step 9 – Tips:
- Stir-fry on high heat for crispiness.
- Do not overcook noodles; keep al dente.
- Toss continuously to avoid sticking.
howToServe: Serve hot, garnished with spring onions. Pair with Schezwan gravy or fried momos for a complete Indo-Chinese meal.

name: Penne Arrabbiata
steps:
Step 1 – Cooking Pasta:
Boil penne in salted water until al dente. Drain and reserve a little pasta water.

Step 2 – Preparing Sauce:
Heat olive oil in a pan. Add minced garlic and sauté until golden. Add red chili flakes and stir for 30 seconds.

Step 3 – Adding Tomato Puree:
Add tomato puree, salt, and black pepper. Simmer for 8–10 minutes until the sauce thickens.

Step 4 – Combining Pasta:
Add cooked penne to the sauce. Toss well to coat pasta evenly. Adjust consistency with reserved pasta water if necessary.

Step 5 – Garnishing:
Turn off heat and sprinkle chopped basil and optionally, Parmesan cheese.

Step 6 – Tips:
- Use fresh tomatoes or high-quality puree for better taste.
- Adjust chili flakes according to desired spiciness.
- Toss pasta immediately in sauce to coat evenly.
howToServe: Serve hot, garnished with fresh basil leaves and Parmesan. Pair with garlic bread or fresh salad.

name: BBQ Chicken Pizza
ingredients: Black pepper – freshly ground, to taste
steps:
Step 1 – Preheating Oven:
Preheat oven to 220°C (428°F) to ensure even cooking.

Step 2 – Preparing Chicken:
Shred cooked chicken and toss with 2 tablespoons of BBQ sauce. Ensure every piece is coated evenly for flavor.

Step 3 – Preparing Pizza Base:
Place pizza base on a lightly greased baking tray or pizza stone. Brush with olive oil lightly for crispiness.

Step 4 – Layering Base Sauce:
Spread a thin layer of remaining BBQ sauce over the base, leaving 1 cm around the edges for crust.

Step 5 – Adding Toppings:
Distribute shredded BBQ chicken evenly on the pizza base. Add sliced onions and capsicum over the chicken.

Step 6 – Adding Cheese:
Sprinkle grated mozzarella generously on top of the toppings.

Step 7 – Baking:
Place pizza in preheated oven and bake for 12–15 minutes or until cheese melts and edges are golden brown.

Step 8 – Finishing Touches:
Remove pizza from oven. Sprinkle freshly chopped coriander and season with salt and black pepper.

Step 9 – Serving:
Slice pizza into 6–8 pieces using a pizza cutter.

Step 10 – Tips:
- Pre-cook vegetables if desired for softer texture.
- Do not overload pizza with toppings to avoid sogginess.
- Serve immediately to enjoy melted cheese and crispy crust.
howToServe: Serve hot, sliced, garnished with fresh coriander. Pair with chili flakes or garlic dip for enhanced flavor.

name: Veggie Supreme Pizza
steps:
Step 1 – Preheating Oven:
Preheat oven to 220°C (428°F) for even baking.

Step 2 – Preparing Base:
Place pizza base on a lightly greased tray. Brush lightly with olive oil.

Step 3 – Adding Sauce:
Spread tomato sauce evenly over base, leaving edges for crust.

Step 4 – Layering Cheese and Veggies:
Sprinkle half of mozzarella first, then add mushrooms, capsicum, onions, and olives. Top with remaining cheese.

Step 5 – Seasoning:
Sprinkle oregano and chili flakes evenly for flavor.

Step 6 – Baking:
Bake in preheated oven for 12–15 minutes until cheese melts and crust is golden brown.

Step 7 – Finishing Touches:
Remove from oven and allow 2 minutes to set.

Step 8 – Serving:
Slice into 6–8 pieces.

Step 9 – Tips:
- Use fresh vegetables for crunch.
- Avoid too much sauce to prevent soggy crust.
- Serve immediately for best taste.
howToServe: Serve hot with chili flakes or tomato ketchup. Garnish with fresh basil leaves if desired.

name: Spicy Paneer Burger
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Paneer:
Mix oil, red chili powder, turmeric, and salt. Toss paneer cubes in this mixture.

Step 2 – Frying Paneer:
Heat pan over medium heat and shallow fry paneer until golden brown on all sides.

Step 3 – Preparing Sauce:
Mix mayonnaise and tomato ketchup in a small bowl.

Step 4 – Assembling Burger:
Place lettuce on bottom bun. Add tomato and onion slices. Place fried paneer on top and drizzle sauce.

Step 5 – Topping Bun:
Cover with top bun.

Step 6 – Serving:
Serve immediately for crunch and warmth.

Step 7 – Tips:
- Use fresh paneer for soft interior.
- Lightly toast buns for crispness.
- Adjust spice to taste.
howToServe: Serve hot with French fries or potato wedges. Optionally, add chili sauce for extra heat.

name: Pepperoni Pizza
steps:
Step 1 – Preheating Oven:
Preheat oven to 220°C (428°F).

Step 2 – Preparing Base:
Brush pizza base with olive oil and spread tomato sauce evenly.

Step 3 – Layering Cheese and Toppings:
Sprinkle half cheese, add pepperoni, onions, and capsicum. Top with remaining cheese.

Step 4 – Seasoning:
Sprinkle oregano and chili flakes.

Step 5 – Baking:
Bake for 12–15 minutes until cheese melts and crust is golden.

Step 6 – Finishing:
Remove from oven, let cool 1–2 minutes.

Step 7 – Serving:
Slice into pieces.

Step 8 – Tips:
- Use good quality pepperoni.
- Serve hot for best taste.
howToServe: Serve hot with chili flakes, oregano, or garlic dip. Perfect for parties or quick meals.

name: Mushroom Swiss Burger
ingredients: Black pepper – freshly ground, to taste
steps:
Step 1 – Sautéing Mushrooms:
Heat butter in a pan. Add mushrooms, salt, and pepper. Sauté until golden brown and moisture evaporates.

Step 2 – Preparing Buns:
Lightly toast burger buns.

Step 3 – Assembling Burger:
Place lettuce on bottom bun. Add tomato slice. Place sautéed mushrooms. Top with Swiss cheese slice.

Step 4 – Covering Bun:
Add mayonnaise/mustard on top bun and cover.

Step 5 – Serving:
Serve immediately while cheese is slightly melted.

Step 6 – Tips:
- Use fresh mushrooms for best texture.
- Toast buns for added crispiness.
- Serve immediately to enjoy warmth and flavor.
howToServe: Serve hot with French fries or potato wedges. Pair with ketchup or chili sauce for enhanced flavor.

name: Egg Biryani
ingredients: Whole spices: 4 cloves, 2 cardamom, 1 cinnamon stick, 1 bay leaf
Saffron – optional, soaked in 2 tablespoons warm milk
steps:
Step 1 – Frying Onions:
Heat ghee in a pan over medium heat. Fry sliced onions until golden brown and crisp. Remove half for garnish and leave remaining onions in the pan for the masala.

Step 2 – Preparing Egg Masala:
Add ginger-garlic paste to the onions in the pan and sauté until aromatic. Stir in turmeric, red chili powder, and garam masala. Add a pinch of salt. Cut boiled eggs in halves and gently coat them with this masala, cooking for 2–3 minutes to infuse flavor.

Step 3 – Cooking Rice:
Boil water in a large pot with whole spices and salt. Add soaked rice and cook until 70% done. Drain water and keep rice ready.

Step 4 – Layering Biryani:
In a heavy-bottomed pan, spread half the cooked rice. Arrange the spiced eggs evenly over it. Sprinkle chopped mint and coriander leaves. Top with remaining rice and drizzle saffron milk if using.

Step 5 – Dum Cooking:
Cover tightly with a lid or foil and cook on very low heat for 20 minutes to let flavors meld.

Step 6 – Resting:
Remove from heat and allow the biryani to rest for 5 minutes. This ensures separate fluffy grains.

Step 7 – Fluffing and Garnishing:
Gently fluff the rice to mix eggs and rice without breaking eggs. Garnish with reserved fried onions.

Step 8 – Tips:
Use fresh eggs and Basmati rice for aromatic, fluffy biryani. Layering spices evenly enhances flavor. Serve immediately for best taste.
howToServe: Serve hot with cucumber raita, salad, and papad. Garnish with fried onions and fresh coriander for presentation.

name: Paneer Biryani
ingredients: Whole spices: 4 cloves, 2 cardamom, 1 cinnamon stick, 1 bay leaf
Saffron – optional, soaked in 2 tablespoons warm milk
steps:
Step 1 – Frying Paneer:
Heat 2 tablespoons ghee in a pan. Lightly fry paneer cubes until golden. Remove and set aside.

Step 2 – Frying Onions:
In the same pan, sauté sliced onions until golden brown. Remove half for garnish and retain the rest for cooking masala.

Step 3 – Preparing Masala:
Add ginger-garlic paste to remaining onions and cook until aromatic. Add turmeric, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and fold in whisked yogurt. Add fried paneer cubes and cook gently for 3–4 minutes to coat paneer with spices.

Step 4 – Cooking Rice:
Boil water with whole spices and salt. Add soaked rice and cook until 70% done. Drain and set aside.

Step 5 – Layering Biryani:
In a heavy-bottomed pan, spread half the rice, layer the paneer masala, sprinkle mint and coriander, then top with remaining rice. Drizzle saffron milk over top if desired.

Step 6 – Dum Cooking:
Cover tightly and cook on low heat for 20 minutes to allow flavors to blend.

Step 7 – Resting:
Remove from heat and let rest for 5 minutes.

Step 8 – Fluffing and Garnishing:
Gently mix to combine rice and paneer without breaking cubes. Garnish with reserved fried onions.

Step 9 – Tips:
Use fresh paneer for softness. Layer herbs and spices evenly for balanced flavor. Serve hot for best taste.
howToServe: Serve hot with raita, salad, and papad. Garnish with fried onions and fresh coriander.

name: Vegetable Biryani
ingredients: Whole spices: 4 cloves, 2 cardamom, 1 cinnamon stick, 1 bay leaf
Saffron – optional, soaked in 2 tablespoons warm milk
steps:
Step 1 – Frying Onions:
Heat ghee in a pan. Sauté onions until golden brown. Remove half for garnish.

Step 2 – Cooking Vegetables:
Add ginger-garlic paste, sauté 1 minute. Add diced vegetables and cook 5–6 minutes until slightly tender. Mix turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Stir well.

Step 3 – Adding Yogurt:
Fold in whisked yogurt and half of the chopped herbs. Cook for 3–4 minutes until yogurt is absorbed.

Step 4 – Cooking Rice:
Boil water with whole spices and salt. Add soaked rice and cook until 70% done. Drain and keep ready.

Step 5 – Layering Biryani:
In a heavy-bottomed pan, layer half rice, vegetables, herbs, and remaining rice. Drizzle saffron milk if desired.

Step 6 – Dum Cooking:
Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes. Let flavors meld.

Step 7 – Resting:
Remove and rest 5 minutes.

Step 8 – Fluffing and Garnishing:
Gently fluff rice and vegetables. Garnish with fried onions and remaining herbs.

Step 9 – Tips:
Use fresh vegetables for crunch. Avoid overcooking rice. Serve hot for aroma and taste.
howToServe: Serve with raita, salad, and papad. Garnish with fried onions and fresh coriander.

name: Prawn Biryani
ingredients: Whole spices: 4 cloves, 2 cardamom, 1 cinnamon stick, 1 bay leaf
Saffron – optional, soaked in 2 tablespoons warm milk
steps:
Step 1 – Frying Onions:
Heat ghee in a pan. Sauté onions until golden. Remove half for garnish.

Step 2 – Cooking Prawns:
Add ginger-garlic paste, sauté 1 minute. Add prawns, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt. Cook 4–5 minutes until prawns are just done. Fold in whisked yogurt and half of chopped herbs.

Step 3 – Cooking Rice:
Boil water with whole spices and salt. Add soaked rice and cook until 70% done. Drain and keep ready.

Step 4 – Layering Biryani:
In a heavy-bottomed pan, layer half rice, prawns, herbs, remaining rice, and drizzle saffron milk.

Step 5 – Dum Cooking:
Cover tightly and cook on low heat for 15–20 minutes. Let flavors meld.

Step 6 – Resting:
Remove and rest 5 minutes.

Step 7 – Fluffing and Garnishing:
Gently mix rice and prawns. Garnish with fried onions and remaining herbs.

Step 8 – Tips:
Do not overcook prawns. Keep rice fluffy. Serve hot.
howToServe: Serve with raita, salad, and lemon wedges. Garnish with fried onions and fresh coriander.

name: Vegetable Pulav
ingredients: Whole spices: 4 cloves, 2 cardamom, 1 cinnamon stick, 1 bay leaf
steps:
Step 1 – Frying Onions:
Heat ghee in a pan. Sauté onions until golden brown.

Step 2 – Cooking Vegetables:
Add ginger-garlic paste, sauté 1 minute. Add diced vegetables and cook 5–6 minutes until slightly tender. Season with salt and black pepper.

Step 3 – Cooking Rice:
Boil water with whole spices. Add soaked rice and cook until 70% done. Drain and keep ready.

Step 4 – Layering Pulav:
In a heavy-bottomed pan, mix partially cooked rice with sautéed vegetables. Cover tightly.

Step 5 – Dum Cooking:
Cook on low heat for 10–15 minutes to let flavors blend and rice finish cooking.

Step 6 – Fluffing:
Gently fluff rice and vegetables to mix evenly.

Step 7 – Garnishing:
Sprinkle chopped coriander leaves for freshness.

Step 8 – Tips:
Use fresh vegetables. Avoid overcooking rice. Serve immediately for best aroma and flavor.
howToServe: Serve hot with raita, salad, or pickle. Garnish with fresh coriander.

name: Watermelon Feta Mint Salad
ingredients: 4 cups watermelon – cut into bite-sized cubes, chilled.
1 cup cucumber – peeled, deseeded, and diced.
1 teaspoon honey – optional, for added sweetness.
Freshly ground black pepper – to taste.
1 tablespoon roasted pumpkin seeds – for garnish (optional).
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing the Ingredients:
Start by chilling the watermelon for at least an hour before making the salad to ensure it is crisp and refreshing. Cut the watermelon into bite-sized cubes, discarding any seeds. Place them in a large mixing bowl.

Step 2 – Prepping the Cucumber:
Peel the cucumber, slice it lengthwise, and scoop out the seeds with a spoon to avoid excess water in the salad. Dice into small pieces and add them to the bowl with the watermelon.

Step 3 – Adding Feta and Mint:
Crumble the feta cheese directly into the bowl. Tear fresh mint leaves with your hands (instead of chopping) to preserve their oils and prevent bruising, then sprinkle over the salad.

Step 4 – Making the Dressing:
In a small bowl or jar, whisk together extra virgin olive oil, lime juice, honey (if using), a pinch of salt, and freshly ground black pepper. The lime juice brightens the flavors, while honey balances the tang.

Step 5 – Tossing the Salad:
Pour the dressing over the watermelon mixture. Using a large spoon, gently toss to combine, ensuring the watermelon cubes remain intact and the dressing coats all ingredients evenly.

Step 6 – Garnishing:
For added texture and a nutty crunch, sprinkle roasted pumpkin seeds on top just before serving. You can also add an extra sprinkle of feta or mint leaves for visual appeal.

Step 7 – Chilling Before Serving:
If not serving immediately, cover the salad and refrigerate for up to 30 minutes. This allows the flavors to meld without the watermelon releasing too much liquid.

Step 8 – Serving:
Serve in chilled bowls or plates for the most refreshing experience. Make sure to give the salad a gentle toss before plating if it has been sitting.

Additional Tips:
- Use seedless watermelon for ease.
- Replace feta with goat cheese for a creamier texture.
- Add thinly sliced red onions for a sharp flavor contrast.
- Do not overdress the salad; the natural watermelon juice also acts as part of the dressing.
- Best enjoyed fresh to maintain crunch and freshness.
howToServe: Serve in chilled salad bowls or wide plates for a refreshing summer starter. Garnish with extra mint leaves and feta crumbles for a restaurant-style presentation.

name: Asian Sesame Cabbage Salad
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Vegetables:
Shred both cabbages finely and place in a large mixing bowl. Julienne carrots and add to the bowl along with chopped green onions.

Step 2 – Toasting Seeds and Nuts:
In a dry skillet over low heat, toast sesame seeds until light golden. Set aside. Roughly chop roasted peanuts.

Step 3 – Making Dressing:
In a small bowl, whisk together rice vinegar, sesame oil, soy sauce, honey, grated ginger, salt, and pepper until smooth.

Step 4 – Assembling Salad:
Pour dressing over the cabbage mixture and toss until evenly coated.

Step 5 – Garnishing:
Sprinkle toasted sesame seeds and chopped peanuts over the salad for crunch.

Step 6 – Tips:
For extra freshness, chill vegetables before adding dressing. Toss just before serving to keep crunch.
howToServe: Serve immediately in a deep bowl, garnished with extra sesame seeds. Pair with grilled meat or tofu.

name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Ingredients:
Drain and rinse chickpeas thoroughly. Dice cucumber, halve cherry tomatoes, and finely chop red onion and parsley.

Step 2 – Making Dressing:
In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper until combined.

Step 3 – Assembling Salad:
In a large mixing bowl, combine chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes, onion, parsley, and olives. Drizzle dressing and toss until evenly coated.

Step 4 – Resting:
Allow salad to rest for 10 minutes for flavors to develop.

Step 5 – Tips:
Use fresh parsley for a bright taste. Adjust lemon juice for desired tanginess.
howToServe: Serve chilled or at room temperature in a shallow platter. Garnish with extra parsley.

name: Roasted Beetroot & Orange Salad
steps:
Step 1 – Roasting Beets:
Preheat oven to 200°C. Toss beet cubes with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking tray and roast for 25–30 minutes until tender. Cool slightly.

Step 2 – Preparing Oranges:
Peel and segment oranges, removing seeds.

Step 3 – Making Dressing:
Whisk balsamic vinegar, honey, salt, and pepper until smooth.

Step 4 – Assembling Salad:
In a bowl, combine roasted beets, orange segments, and toasted walnuts. Drizzle dressing and toss lightly.

Step 5 – Garnishing:
Sprinkle crumbled feta on top.

Step 6 – Tips:
Cool beets before mixing to avoid melting cheese.
howToServe: Serve in a shallow plate for color contrast. Best enjoyed slightly chilled.

name: Tropical Mango Avocado Salad
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Fruits:
Peel and dice mangoes and avocado, making sure they are bite-sized.

Step 2 – Mixing Base:
In a large bowl, combine mango, avocado, cherry tomatoes, and red onion.

Step 3 – Making Dressing:
Whisk together lime juice, olive oil, honey, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.

Step 4 – Tossing:
Pour dressing over the salad and toss gently to avoid breaking avocado pieces.

Step 5 – Garnishing:
Sprinkle fresh cilantro over the salad for aroma and color.

Step 6 – Serving:
Serve immediately to prevent avocado browning.
howToServe: Serve in chilled bowls as a refreshing side for grilled meats or seafood.

name: Singapore Chili Crab
ingredients: 2 whole mud crabs (about 1.2 kg total) – cleaned and cut into halves.
2 red chilies – chopped (adjust to heat preference).
1 teaspoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water.
steps:
Step 1 – Preparing Crab:
Clean crabs thoroughly under running water, removing gills and trimming sharp edges. Cut each crab into halves or quarters for easier cooking and serving.

Step 2 – Sautéing Aromatics:
Heat vegetable oil in a large wok over medium heat. Add chopped onion, minced garlic, ginger, and chopped chilies. Stir-fry for 2–3 minutes until fragrant and softened.

Step 3 – Making Chili Sauce Base:
Add tomato ketchup, chili sauce, soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Stir to combine and cook for 1–2 minutes until sauces are slightly caramelized.

Step 4 – Adding Stock and Sugar:
Pour in chicken stock and stir in sugar. Bring to a gentle boil to meld flavors.

Step 5 – Cooking Crab:
Place crab pieces into the wok, tossing to coat in sauce. Cover and cook for 8–10 minutes, turning occasionally until crab shells turn bright orange and meat is cooked through.

Step 6 – Thickening Sauce:
Stir in cornstarch slurry while sauce simmers. Continue stirring until sauce thickens to a glossy consistency.

Step 7 – Adding Egg:
Slowly drizzle beaten eggs into the wok while stirring gently to create silky ribbons in the sauce.

Step 8 – Finishing:
Garnish with fresh coriander. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
howToServe: Serve hot with steamed mantou buns or jasmine rice to soak up the rich chili-tomato sauce.

name: Crab Masala Fry
ingredients: 1 kg fresh crabs – cleaned and halved.
steps:
Step 1 – Cleaning and Prepping Crab:
Clean crabs thoroughly, removing unwanted parts, and cut into halves.

Step 2 – Heating Oil and Sautéing:
In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat coconut oil over medium flame. Add sliced onions, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.

Step 3 – Adding Aromatics:
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 1–2 minutes until raw aroma disappears.

Step 4 – Cooking Masala:
Stir in chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes soften and oil separates from the masala.

Step 5 – Cooking Crab:
Add cleaned crab pieces to the masala. Toss to coat evenly. Cover and cook for 8–10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Step 6 – Final Seasoning:
Sprinkle garam masala and chopped coriander. Stir well and cook for another 2 minutes.
howToServe: Serve hot with steamed rice or Kerala parotta for a bold, spicy crab feast.

name: Crab Thermidor
ingredients: 500 grams crab meat – fresh or cooked.
steps:
Step 1 – Prepping Crab Meat:
If using whole crabs, cook them in boiling salted water for 8–10 minutes, then extract the meat carefully.

Step 2 – Making Sauce Base:
Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and garlic, sauté until translucent.

Step 3 – Thickening Sauce:
Add flour and stir for 1–2 minutes to form a roux. Gradually whisk in milk and cream, stirring until smooth.

Step 4 – Flavoring:
Add Dijon mustard, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Stir well and cook for 2 minutes.

Step 5 – Adding Crab and Cheese:
Fold in crab meat and Parmesan cheese. Mix until heated through.

Step 6 – Assembling and Baking:
Spoon mixture into cleaned crab shells or ramekins. Top with cheddar cheese and broil until golden.
howToServe: Serve with crusty bread or a light green salad for an indulgent seafood dish.

name: Black Pepper Crab
ingredients: 2 tablespoons coarse black pepper – freshly ground.
steps:
Step 1 – Heating Oil and Butter:
Heat vegetable oil and butter together in a wok over medium heat.

Step 2 – Aromatics:
Add chopped onion and garlic, stir-frying until fragrant.

Step 3 – Adding Crab:
Place crab pieces in the wok and toss well.

Step 4 – Seasoning:
Add black pepper, soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, and salt. Toss to coat evenly.

Step 5 – Cooking:
Cover and cook for 8–10 minutes, stirring occasionally until crab is fully cooked.

Step 6 – Finishing:
Garnish with chopped coriander before serving.
howToServe: Serve hot with steamed white rice to balance the bold black pepper flavor.

name: Steamed Crab with Ginger and Scallions
ingredients: 4 stalks scallions – cut into 5 cm lengths.
steps:
Step 1 – Prepping Crab:
Clean crabs and cut into halves.

Step 2 – Steaming Setup:
Place a steaming rack in a wok or large pot and bring water to a boil.

Step 3 – Arranging Ingredients:
Place ginger slices and scallions on a heatproof plate. Arrange crab pieces on top. Drizzle Shaoxing wine over.

Step 4 – Steaming:
Cover and steam over high heat for 12–15 minutes until crab shells turn bright orange and meat is opaque.

Step 5 – Final Touch:
Drizzle soy sauce and sesame oil before serving.
howToServe: Serve immediately with steamed jasmine rice and extra soy sauce for dipping.

name: Mangalorean Fish Curry
ingredients: 500 g firm white fish (seer, snapper, or kingfish) – cut into medium pieces
steps:
Begin by preparing the masala paste, which forms the heart of Mangalorean fish curry. In a dry pan over low heat, toast the dried red chilies, coriander seeds, and cumin seeds for 2–3 minutes until aromatic. This toasting deepens their flavor without burning them. Once toasted, transfer to a blender jar along with freshly grated coconut, turmeric powder, garlic cloves, ginger, and a small splash of water. Grind into a smooth, thick paste, adding water in small increments to achieve a silky consistency.

In a wide, heavy-bottomed pan, heat coconut oil over medium flame. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown, about 5–6 minutes. Add chopped tomatoes and cook them down until soft and the oil begins to separate from the mixture. Now, stir in the freshly ground masala paste. Fry the paste for 4–5 minutes, allowing it to release its fragrant oils. This slow frying step is crucial — it tames the raw spice flavor and builds depth.

Once the paste is fried, add tamarind paste and 2 cups of water, stirring well to combine. Bring the curry to a gentle simmer. Season with salt. Now, carefully slide in the fish pieces, ensuring they are submerged in the curry without overcrowding. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 6–8 minutes, just until the fish is opaque and flakes easily when pressed with a fork. Avoid over-stirring to prevent the fish from breaking.

Taste the curry and adjust seasoning or tamarind for more tang if needed. Finally, garnish with fresh coriander. The curry should be rich, tangy, and coconut-forward, with a warm spice profile typical of coastal Karnataka.

Serve immediately while hot, allowing the fish to soak in the flavors.
howToServe: Serve with steamed boiled rice or neer dosa for an authentic Mangalorean experience.

name: Malabar Fish Moilee
ingredients: 500 g seer fish or pearl spot – cut into steaks
steps:
Begin by patting the fish steaks dry and lightly seasoning them with salt and turmeric powder. Heat 2 tablespoons of coconut oil in a wide pan over medium heat and gently sear the fish pieces for 1–2 minutes on each side — not to cook them through, but to seal the surface. Remove and set aside.

In the same pan, add another tablespoon of coconut oil. Add sliced onions, curry leaves, green chilies, ginger, and garlic. Sauté for 3–4 minutes until onions turn translucent and fragrant. Sprinkle in the turmeric powder and black pepper powder, stirring for 30 seconds to release their aroma.

Pour in the thin coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer. Slide in the seared fish pieces, making sure they are partly submerged in the coconut broth. Simmer gently for 6–7 minutes, turning the fish halfway through, until cooked through. Avoid vigorous stirring.

Lower the heat to the bare minimum and gently stir in the thick coconut milk. Let the curry warm through without boiling, as boiling thick coconut milk can cause it to split. Finally, stir in the lemon juice for brightness.

This Malabar classic should taste creamy, mildly spiced, and delicately fragrant — more about the richness of coconut milk than aggressive chili heat.
howToServe: Serve with appam, idiyappam, or steamed rice for a soft, comforting meal.

name: Bengali Shorshe Maach (Mustard Fish Curry)
ingredients: 500 g rohu or hilsa fish – cut into pieces
steps:
Soak the mustard seeds and green chilies in warm water for 15 minutes. Drain and grind into a fine paste with a little salt, adding minimal water to keep it thick.

Rub the fish pieces with turmeric powder and salt. Heat mustard oil in a pan until it just begins to smoke — this reduces its pungency. Lower the heat slightly and gently fry the fish pieces for 1–2 minutes per side until lightly golden. Remove and set aside.

In the same pan, add the mustard paste and fry on low heat for 2–3 minutes, stirring to prevent burning. Add a cup of water to thin the sauce, season with salt, and bring to a simmer.

Carefully place the fish pieces into the sauce and cook for 5–6 minutes on low heat until tender. Avoid stirring too much.

This curry is sharp, earthy, and distinctly Bengali thanks to the pungency of mustard and green chili heat.
howToServe: Serve with steamed white rice and a wedge of lime for authenticity.

name: Chettinad Fish Curry
ingredients: 500 g kingfish or snapper – cut into steaks
steps:
Heat sesame oil in a deep pan over medium flame. Add chopped onions and curry leaves, sauté until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.

Stir in tomatoes and cook until soft. Add coriander, cumin, red chili, and turmeric powders. Fry for 1–2 minutes.

Pour in tamarind water and 2 cups water, season with salt, and bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes to develop flavors.

Add fish pieces and cook gently for 8 minutes until fish is cooked through. Avoid overcooking.

This curry is bold, tangy, and spicy with a signature Chettinad aroma.
howToServe: Serve with hot steamed rice or dosa for a South Indian treat.

name: Thai Steamed Fish with Lime and Garlic
ingredients: 1 whole sea bass – cleaned and scaled
steps:
Clean the fish thoroughly, pat dry, and make shallow diagonal cuts on each side to help the seasoning penetrate.

In a bowl, mix minced garlic, lime juice, fish sauce, sugar, and chopped chilies. Stir until sugar dissolves.

Place the fish in a steamer over boiling water and steam for 8–10 minutes until flesh flakes easily.

Once steamed, transfer fish to a serving plate and pour the lime-garlic sauce over it.

Garnish with fresh coriander and lime slices for a fresh, aromatic finish.
howToServe: Serve immediately with jasmine rice to soak up the tangy-spicy sauce.

name: Malabar Prawn Roast
ingredients: 500 g medium prawns – cleaned and deveined
steps:
Start by cleaning and deveining the prawns. Pat them dry and marinate with turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Set aside for 15 minutes.

Heat coconut oil in a heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown. Add curry leaves, slit green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste, frying until fragrant.

Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and oil begins to separate. Stir in coriander powder and garam masala, frying for another minute to bloom the spices.

Add the marinated prawns to the pan. Cook on medium-high heat for 3–4 minutes, stirring gently so the prawns cook evenly. They should turn pink and curl slightly.

Reduce heat and allow the mixture to roast slowly, letting the prawns absorb the masala flavors. Avoid overcooking to keep them juicy.

Once done, garnish with fresh coriander and serve immediately.
howToServe: Best served with Kerala parotta or steamed rice.

name: Prawn Masala Fry
steps:
Marinate the prawns with turmeric powder, chili powder, and salt. Set aside.

Heat oil in a skillet. Add onions and sauté until soft. Add ginger-garlic paste and fry until raw smell disappears.

Add tomatoes and cook until mushy. Stir in coriander powder and green chilies.

Add prawns and fry over high heat for 2 minutes. Reduce flame and cook until prawns are just done, about 5 minutes.

Garnish with coriander and serve hot.
howToServe: Serve with chapati, dosa, or rice.

name: Andhra Spicy Prawn Curry
steps:
Heat oil in a large pan. Add onions and fry until golden. Add curry leaves and ginger-garlic paste.

Add tomatoes and cook until oil separates. Add all dry spices and stir for 1 minute.

Add prawns and mix well. Cover and cook for 8 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Simmer until gravy thickens and prawns are cooked through.

Serve garnished with coriander.
howToServe: Pairs well with steamed rice or pulka.

name: Thai Red Curry Prawns
steps:
Heat oil in a pan. Add red curry paste and fry for 1–2 minutes.

Add coconut milk, fish sauce, and sugar. Stir to combine.

Add bell peppers and cook for 2 minutes.

Add prawns and simmer until they turn pink and are cooked through, about 5 minutes.

Garnish with basil leaves.
howToServe: Serve with jasmine rice.

name: Prawn Pulao
steps:
Heat ghee in a deep pan. Add onions and sauté until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and fry briefly.

Add tomatoes, turmeric, and garam masala. Cook until tomatoes soften.

Add prawns and cook for 3 minutes. Add soaked rice, coconut milk, and water.

Bring to a boil, then simmer covered until rice is cooked.

Fluff gently and serve hot.
howToServe: Best enjoyed with cucumber raita.

name: Jeera Aloo
ingredients: 500 g baby potatoes – boiled and peeled
steps:
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and allow them to crackle.

Add green chilies and sauté briefly.

Add boiled potatoes, turmeric, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Toss gently until well coated.

Cook for 4–5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until slightly crisp.

Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot.
howToServe: Pairs well with puri, paratha, or dal-chawal.

name: Bhindi Fry
ingredients: 300 g ladyfinger (bhindi) – washed and cut into 1-inch pieces
steps:
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.

Add sliced onions and sauté until light golden.

Add bhindi, turmeric, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt.

Cook uncovered on medium heat for 10–12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until bhindi is tender and slightly crisp.

Serve immediately.
howToServe: Best with chapati or as a side for dal-rice.

name: Baingan Bharta
steps:
Roast the eggplant directly over an open flame or in the oven until skin is charred and flesh is soft. Cool, peel, and mash.

Heat oil in a pan, add onions and sauté until golden.

Add ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes soften.

Add turmeric, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.

Stir in the mashed eggplant, cook for 5–6 minutes.

Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with coriander.
howToServe: Serve with hot roti or paratha.

name: Aloo Gobi
steps:
Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.

Add onions, sauté until golden.

Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.

Add tomatoes, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes soften.

Add potatoes and cauliflower, mix well.

Cover and cook on low heat for 12–15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender.

Sprinkle garam masala before serving.
howToServe: Perfect with roti or as a side to dal-chawal.

name: Paneer Bhurji
steps:
Heat oil in a pan, add onions, and sauté until translucent.

Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili, sauté for 1 minute.

Add tomatoes, turmeric, coriander powder, and red chili powder. Cook until tomatoes are soft.

Add crumbled paneer and salt. Mix well and cook for 3–4 minutes.

Garnish with fresh coriander.
howToServe: Serve with paratha, pav, or as a filling for wraps.

name: Tomato Basil Soup
ingredients: 1 tablespoon fresh cream – optional for garnish
steps:
Heat olive oil in a pot, add onions and sauté until translucent.

Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds.

Add tomatoes and cook for 6–8 minutes until softened.

Pour in vegetable broth, bring to a boil, then simmer for 15 minutes.

Add basil leaves, then blend until smooth.

Return to the pot, season with salt and pepper.

Serve hot with a drizzle of fresh cream.

name: Sweet Corn Chicken Soup
ingredients: 1 tablespoon cornflour mixed with 2 tablespoons water
steps:
In a pot, combine sweet corn kernels and chicken broth. Bring to a boil.

Add shredded chicken and cook for 3 minutes.

Stir in cornflour slurry to thicken.

Slowly drizzle beaten egg while stirring to form silky strands.

Season with soy sauce, salt, and pepper.

Garnish with chopped spring onions before serving.

name: Hot and Sour Soup
steps:
Heat sesame oil in a pot, add vegetables and sauté for 2–3 minutes.

Add shredded chicken or tofu, and pour in broth.

Add soy sauce, vinegar, chili sauce, and bring to a boil.

Add cornflour slurry and stir until soup thickens.

Season with salt and pepper.

Serve hot.

name: Mulligatawny Soup
steps:
Heat oil in a pot, sauté onions, garlic, and carrot.

Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.

Add curry powder, turmeric, and lentils. Stir well.

Pour in broth, add diced apple, and simmer for 25 minutes.

Blend part of the soup for creaminess, return to pot.

Add coconut milk, season with salt.

Serve hot.

name: Lemon Coriander Soup
steps:
Heat broth in a pot, add carrots, cabbage, green chili, and ginger.

Simmer for 10 minutes until vegetables are tender.

Add lemon juice and coriander leaves just before turning off the heat.

Season with salt and pepper.

Serve hot for a refreshing tangy flavor.

name: Vegetable Upma
steps:
Dry roast semolina in a pan until aromatic, set aside.

Heat ghee or oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, and chana dal. Let them splutter.

Add curry leaves, green chilies, and ginger. Sauté onions until translucent.

Add carrots, beans, and peas. Stir-fry for 2–3 minutes.

Pour in water, add salt, and bring to a boil.

Slowly add roasted semolina while stirring to avoid lumps.

Cook on low flame until water is absorbed and upma is soft.

Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

name: Tamarind Rice (Puliyodarai)
steps:
Heat sesame oil in a pan, splutter mustard seeds.

Add urad dal, chana dal, dried red chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté until golden.

Pour in tamarind extract, add turmeric powder, salt, and jaggery.

Cook on medium flame until oil separates and the mixture thickens.

Mix this tamarind paste with cooked rice and roasted peanuts.

Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Lemon Rice
steps:
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.

Add urad dal, chana dal, green chilies, ginger, and curry leaves. Fry until golden.

Stir in turmeric powder and salt.

Remove from heat, add lemon juice, and mix well.

Toss this tempering with cooked rice until evenly coated.

Garnish with fresh coriander and serve.

name: Vangi Bath (Brinjal Rice)
steps:
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.

Add urad dal, chana dal, red chilies, and curry leaves; sauté until golden.

Add chopped brinjal, turmeric, and salt; cook until soft.

Stir in vangi bath powder and mix well.

Combine cooked rice with the prepared brinjal masala.

Garnish with coriander and serve.

name: Pesarattu (Green Gram Dosa)
ingredients: 1 cup whole green gram (moong dal) – soaked overnight
steps:
Grind soaked green gram with green chilies, ginger, and salt into a smooth batter.

Heat a dosa pan, pour a ladle of batter, spread thin.

Sprinkle onions and coriander over the dosa.

Drizzle oil around edges; cook until golden.

Serve hot with chutney.

name: Paneer Tikka
steps:
In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, lemon juice, salt, and oil.

Add paneer cubes, onion, and capsicum; coat well. Marinate for at least 1 hour.

Thread onto skewers and grill or bake until golden with char marks.

Serve hot with mint chutney.

name: Chicken Malai Tikka
ingredients: 500 g boneless chicken – cut into cubes
steps:
Mix cream, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, white pepper, lemon juice, and salt.

Add chicken cubes and marinate for 2–3 hours.

Skewer chicken and grill until cooked through and lightly charred.

Serve hot with coriander-mint chutney.

name: Hara Bhara Kabab
steps:
Mash spinach, peas, and potatoes together.

Add ginger-garlic paste, green chili, garam masala, cumin powder, and salt.

Shape into small patties.

Shallow fry until golden and crisp.

Serve with green chutney.

name: Tandoori Prawns
steps:
Combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, lemon juice, salt, and oil.

Add prawns and marinate for 30 minutes.

Grill or bake until prawns turn pink and slightly charred.

Serve with lemon wedges and onion rings.

name: Stuffed Mushroom Caps
steps:
Remove mushroom stems and chop them finely.

Mix stems with cheese, bread crumbs, onions, capsicum, herbs, salt, and pepper.

Stuff this mixture into mushroom caps.

Drizzle with olive oil and bake at 180°C for 12–15 minutes.

Serve hot.

name: Kaju Katli
steps:
Grind cashews to a fine powder.

Heat sugar and water in a pan to make a one-string consistency syrup.

Add cashew powder, stir on low flame until thick.

Add ghee, mix, and spread mixture on a greased plate.

Roll flat, apply silver vark if desired, cut into diamonds.

name: Besan Ladoo
steps:
Heat ghee in a pan, add besan, and roast on low flame until golden and aromatic.

Cool slightly, add powdered sugar, cardamom, and nuts.

Mix well and shape into round ladoos.

Store in an airtight container.

name: Mysore Pak
steps:
Sieve besan and keep ready.

Boil sugar and water until one-string consistency.

Add besan gradually, stirring to avoid lumps.

Add ghee little by little, stirring continuously until mixture leaves sides.

Pour into greased tray, cool, and cut into pieces.

name: Badam Halwa
steps:
Grind almonds into a smooth paste with little water.

Heat ghee in a pan, add almond paste, and cook on low flame.

Add sugar and saffron, stir continuously until thick.

Add cardamom powder, mix, and remove from heat.

Serve warm or store in jars.

name: Coconut Ladoo
steps:
In a pan, roast coconut lightly.

Add condensed milk, cardamom, and stir until thick.

Add nuts, mix well.

Shape mixture into small round ladoos.

Let cool and store.
